clinical_study.brief_title: Remodelling After Trampoline Fracture in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Remodelling After Trampoline Fracture in Children

collaborator.agency: Medical Research Council Kantonsspital Aarau, Switzerland

brief_summary.textblock: The anterior tilting of the proximal tibia epiphyseal plate is a radiological tool for the diagnosis of suspected trampoline fracture. The tibial fracture leads to a ventral tilting of the tibial Plateau. This study is to document the long-term follow-up of the anterior tilt angle and to verify, if there is an uplift of the tibia plateau with correction of the anterior tilt angle to normal values (= remodelling) in order to guarantee optimal treatment of this rare fracture.

primary_outcome.measure: anterior tilt angle of the tibia
primary_outcome.description: radiological measurement of the anterior tilt angle of the tibia (degree)

secondary_outcome.measure: difference of anterior tilt angle of the fractured tibia compared with the angle of the healthy tibia
secondary_outcome.description: difference of anterior tilt angle of the fractured tibia compared with the angle of the healthy tibia (degree)

intervention.intervention_name: radiographs in two views of the tibia
intervention.description: The anterior tilt angle of the tibia will be measured by two specialized radiologists according to a specific radiological angle measurement tool (PACS Sectra IDS7TM, Linköping, Sweden).

study_pop.textblock: Children between 2-5 years of life with the diagnosis of a trampoline fracture in the radiographs of the tibia in two views at the Kantonsspital Aarau, Universitätsspital Bern, Universitätskinderspital Zürich, UKBB Universitätsspital Basel, Kantonalspital Luzern.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- trampoline fracture of the proximal lower leg
Exclusion Criteria:
- proximal tibial fractures with unclear etiology

clinical_study.keyword: ventral tilting of the tibial plateau
